Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: OHH-MHTH
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Friendly staff and good rooms. Very good breakfast, but litle expencive (12 euro) Location is ok, Busses stop right front of the hotel, to the Termini or Coluseo and Trevi Fontana. Friendly neighbourhood and not so many travellers. Very nice to go from hotel to right and then right again. There is a stret with lokal food market in the morning and lokal bars and restaurants in evening. Very good and cheap to dine thera. The locals are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but not so great location”
Reviews.Author: mukundsanghi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and found a great deal. The hotel property was new and very modern. the rooms were also perfectly clean and beautifully designed. But the only drawback is its location. It has a not so good connectivity, mainly thru bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but beware of the location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ambi B
Reviews.Content: Well, we got relieved of our electronics equipment on our way to the hotel - so if you want to arrive with all of your belongings - TAKE A TAXI! The hotel itself is wonderful. The breakfast was amazing. It is next to a bus stop which will take you straight to all of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: digitalangel88
Reviews.Content: We had a room for three people, which was lovely and modern (the furnishings were hip and trendy, the whirlpool spa was a nice touch even though none of us figured out how to use it), but a lot of other factors made this a bad experience. The room was extremely hot and stuffy; when we tried to open the window we found it was situated over a railroad track and a busy street, too noisy to leave the window open during the night. There is no air conditioning. The hotel is outside of walking distance to anything. The area is VERY shady; lots of graffiti, garbage everywhere, sketchy characters. I didn't feel safe even walking to the little market around the corner. The hotel staff spoke good English, but were generally unhelpful and cold to most of our inquiries. Eurostars Roma Aeterna is an example that being a new hotel (their website says it was open in 2010) doesn't mean that it's a great hotel. Perks: wifi, spotless, great breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Kasra33
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eurostar Aeterna, is located in one of the worst locations for seeing Rome. Actualy, in a very bad location and very far from historical center of Rome. You can use a bus, but you will lose the time and the bus station is usualy crowded and comes late. The steet behind the hotel has some resturants and bar, but they are not as good as the resturants in the city center, and not atractive for most of tourists. The staff of this hotel are realy unhelpful. When you enter to the hotel nobody comes with you to show the room. The hotel is not decorated good. The website of this hotel says that this hotel is modern, but the fact is that this hotel is not modern, and very very simple. The breakfast is normal. In the end this hotel doesn't have the worth to stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Bad location”
Reviews.Author: Julia Z
Reviews.Content: The room is ok. It is clean but not big. The good thing is they have free in room wifi. But no free breakfast and location is really far from center. You can't walk to center. But there r bars and restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma P
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came to visit Rome for a long weekend on 17th March 2012. On our arrival at the Eurostars Roma Aeterna we were greeted by the Hotel Manager Francesco, who was very helpful. Francesco gave us fantastic advice of where to eat that is reasonably priced, transport and places to visit (including the Trevi Fountain at night – amazing!) The hotel is very modern and clean. It is a little out of the city, but we took a leisurely walk to San Giovanni Square in 10mins and to the Coliseum from there in 15mins. Alternatively, there is a bus stop outside the hotel and a taxi costs around 10 euros. The hotel surroundings are not the prettiest, but we didn't need to go around that area much in our stay. Our favourite part of the hotel was the spa bath, which was heavenly following a full day site-seeing around Rome. Also, we paid extra for breakfast on the last day and it was well worth the 12 euros – we ate around 4 courses of food! All the hotel staff we came across spoke very good English. The help and advice from the hotel staff was invaluable and led to us having a fantastic weekend in Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming visit the city, families and business customers alike. Thank you to everyone at the Eurostars Roma Congress for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: xristoforosRodos
Reviews.Content: great choice,i went 2 times,very good price(55-60 euro),jaccuzi in the room,nice deco and clean rooms,15 min distance from the center with bus,try food in the pedestrian road back of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: ViviA1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my boyfriend's 30th birthday weekend. The hotel itself is nice and modern and the rooms were very clean. The hotel restaurant although small serves lovely italian food which is not too expensive. The location is that central but right outsied the hotel is a busstop which takes you to main attractions such as the colosseum. The metro line when we were there was being extended so I think the hotel location is even better supported now by the metro. Also as the hotel is not in central rome we are able to mix with locals and found some lovely laces to eat just round the corner from the hotel. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - run down area”
Reviews.Author: AlanMatthew
Reviews.Content: Six friends and I stayed at this hotel for five nights between 15th Mar and 20th Mar 2012. We were visiting for (them to go and watch) the Scotland v Italy rugby. We paid approx £50 per night - for single occupancy of double rooms. This is a typical businessmans' hotel - well decorated and staffed and within easy travelling distance from the ceentre of Rome (not that you'd want to go there - its filthy and covered in graffitti). The rooms in the hotel are superb. They are clean and tidy. The bath has an over the bath shoer and a whirlpool thing in the bath itself ( WARNING - don't put much of the bath gel in the bath if you are going to use it tho!!) The hotel itself is situated in a regeneration area - and although it doesn't feel safe at nights, its well patrolled by the Police and we never got any bother (other than from the street beggars). There is a nice little pedestrianised street area behind the hotel which has a fruit market during the day and a supermarket (buy your 66cl bottles of Peroni there for 1.12 Euros and put them in the fridge in your room). At night there are a number of restaurants to chose from - which are (in the main) populated by students. You can buy a three day travel pass at the local tabaconist (tabacchi) for 11 Euro - but no one ever seems to pay on the bus. Catch the 810 into town - it stops right by the Colluseum.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariusF1
Reviews.Content: Location is not so good, the only connection to the centre is a bus which is very crowded. The service at the reception is also not the best. In my opinion it is not a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and good value”
Reviews.Author: MMM54
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a really good value. It is very clean and modern. The bed was comfortable. The rooms aren't spacious but they are ok. The bathroom was very clean. The staff was helpful, especially with the busses. The hotel is in a locals neighborhood with some nice restaurants and wine bars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but customer service from Reception staff lets it down.”
Reviews.Author: JChurches
Reviews.Content: One female Receptionist lets the hotel down due to her lack of proper customer service skills. She was abrupt and never polite, on phone and in person.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME BREAKFAST! BEAUTIFUL ROOMS & BATHROOM!”
Reviews.Author: KirstynNick
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was AMAZING- best breakfast we've ever had!! The room & bathroom were both HUGE and BEAUTIFUL! This was by far the best hotel we stayed at in Europe. We stayed here for 6 nights and it was incredible value for money! The maid's kept our room nice and clean every day and the desk staff were helpful. We had to catch a bus to the city center each day but the bus stop was right outside the hotel and only took 10 mins..if you want a hotel that's walking distance to the city center this hotel isn't the one for you..but if you don't mind catching a bus then this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing!”
Reviews.Author: carlosbar
Reviews.Content: When I was returning back to Rome after some while traveling around the country I could not get the hotel I was before so I did a little research. This hotel appeared and at first I was a little bit concerned about it, the pictures wasn't very accurate and so, but I decided I would try for it. This is really an amazing hotel, they just need to hire some personal photographer to try to show this really nice hotel as is. This is a big complex (almost the whole block) and it's very renewed, brand new rooms, delicious breakfast and the most impressive of all, the price (3 diaries == 1 at holiday inn aurora, only that this hotel is 4 times better than holiday inn aurora). This is ranked as a 4 star, for my personal feelings I would say this is a 5+ star. The staff are very happy to please the guests, this is an extra plus for the hotel. Pros: Price, Rooms, Breakfast, Restaurant, Staff -- some reviewers complained about location, for me this is a pro as this is very near to a lot of views with a bus stop in front of the hotel. Cons: Some rooms are beside the rails, which can be a con for light sleepers. There are rooms that are not on the rails side, remember to ask at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mirjana S
Reviews.Content: Eurostars Roma Aeterna is nice and brand new hotel with friendly stuff (especially friendly and kind was Jordan Petrov, he speaks fluent English, Italian, Serbian... and he is always ready to help...and give good recommendations where to go in the evening). The rooms are new, clean and comfortable and I have to say the bathrooms are very clean. The furniture is modern..which is ok for Rome (I have seen other hotels with old barok style furniture). I like more small, nice boutique hotels with soul...but honestly this is good, modern hotel for great price (3 nights in December was 100 euros per person). The breakfast was great, you can really find everything. The only little problem is that you have to walk to the metro station (10 minutes) or take the bus to the centre (10 minutes to the termini station). But good news is that soon they will have a new metro line 3 and that means hotel will have great connection to the centre and Vatikan... I just hope they won't change the price. I would recommend the hotel and if you like to go out or to see something special just ask the most friendly guy there Jordan Petrov...

Reviews.Title: “Band new and good for business”
Reviews.Author: Roccoandhisbrothers
Reviews.Content: Nice and brand new hotel (2010) with large rooms and lobby. It is located half way of vai casilina one of the Consul avenue (7 in Rome) to get in & out of the city. Best if you have a car, otherwise there is a tram stop, to bring you toward city centre. I'm use to stay to the other Eurostar Congress, but ot be honest this is better and close to the city. Unfortunately there is nothing to see or interesting to watch since we're in the subborg of Rome and plenty of chinese and indian people, but that's is part of the enviroment. I did not have breakfast since I had to leave early morning, but I'm sure is a good choice; by the way price perfromance ratio is very good (€50 only for bed) is difficult to find it in Rome even in the subborg. I think I'll get back again when I'll be travelling to Rome for business.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful rooms, easy access to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Jonapet
Reviews.Content: Great location. Not directly in the city centre, but you can take Bus 105 (ticket 1€ in any newsstand). It is 8th bus stop from Termini station (app. 10 minutes). Area was quiet and I felt safe walking around in the evening. We spent two nights on weekend in February there. Price was €50 + €3 city tax - and it is truly a bargain. Rooms were very clean and looked exactly the same as in the pictures on the web (which as any traveller knows is not always a rule). Hot bathtub brought another plus points for the hotel after all-day walking around the city. Both guys in the reception were super friendly and nice with fluent English. I can not imagine how they handle check-in / check-out with only 2 front desk stations for 144 rooms. As we were here in February and the temperature at night was below zero, the water pipes froze during night and the water was not running in the morning on the last day. But no one can blame the hotel for this I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay-good service”
Reviews.Author: olga1986gr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Roma Aeterna four days. The room was clean and dity, big enough with modern furniture. I liked the bathroom,very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was just wonderful- great variety and very good service, well done! A liitle bit far from historical center, have to take a bus or walk to the metro station, however the prices are very good for waht you get! Overall we had a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chexieamour
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in December and have to say found it to be an absolute wee gem. The hotel itself is a little out the way but there is a fantastic bus service which you get straight across the road from the hotels entrance and tickets are like 1 euro per journey from the little magazine / newspaper stand. After walking around Rome all day and night it was amazing to get in and be able to soak in the jacuzzi bath what a delight! The staff where extremley freindly. We ate in the hotel one night and have to say it was the worst food i have ever eaten however, the wine and beer was beautiful and very reasonably priced. Dont eat the hotel food as there are so many good places to eat round about the hotel which are cheap and very very tasty, This hotel was perfect for a city break, fantastic value for money and when returning to Rome I will be staying here again ..

Reviews.Title: “Short Rome Trip”
Reviews.Author: neilwatson54
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to Rome this time with friends found hotel on trip adviser 4* star hotel at a very reasonable rate. On arrival friendly staff booked us in to our rooms. They were clean spacious and have free Wi Fi.There was an excellent jacuzzi bath shower. The buffet breakfast was one of the best we have had on City breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly and easy to get to sites from. Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Paullee74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here jan 26 to jan 29 2012. Very hapy to have chosen this hotel. modern and warm. Free WiFi - just ask at reception for your code. having a jacuzzi bath is fantastic after the day walking the streets to sooth those aching limbs. Although its beside train line you can't hear it if you get a room at the back. Staff were v friendly. We didn't eat here so can't comment on the food. We preferred to grab food on the go in rome. The hotel is right across the road from the tram station so although it's not in the centre of rome it's easy to get around. 5 mins and 3 stops and you are at Termini station. Hotel staff were very friendly and very attentive any time we needed assistance. Good value and one we would recommend if you like modern hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice restaurant at 5 minute walk. for hotel take earpluges with you”
Reviews.Author: claudia b
Reviews.Content: i think the location was not this bad if you know by forhand your not in the citycenter. I was happy i only stayed 2 nights in the hotel because the bed was very hard and my room was located on the road site, the noise of the traffic was really too loud for me to get a good sleep. If youre planning to choose this hotel, go to restaurant Primo,Via del Pigneto 46. nice restaurant,Good food and wine and only 5minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable, but far from centre”
Reviews.Author: M X
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for everything except location. Spacious, comfortable rooms (a huge bed), very clean etc., but a dodgy area to get lost in, and you have to wait for a tram/bus/taxi into the centre. I'd recommend staying somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: catwoman45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and would have been happy to stay longer. It was very clean and modern and our room was spacious. The jacuzzi bath was lovely to soak in after a day sightseeing. The breakfast (which was included in our rate) was excellent - plenty of choice and good quality. As mentioned by other reviewers the location is some way from all the tourist attractions, however we had no problem using the local bus which cost 1 euro. I felt we saw so much more of Rome by using public transport and it was good to see an area where actual Romans live. The area is not picturesque, unless you find graffiti attractive, however once you look past this, there are some decent restaurants whch are reasonably priced. Have already recommended this hotel to family.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists - too far away, horrible location!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLP11
Reviews.Content: Location is a HUGE disappointment. What you save on rates, you spend on taxis. Their website says 12mins. We're fast walkers and it took us an average of 25mins and we got lost on our way there. Scary experience. The area is very dodgy and feels unsafe and very dirty. Local transportation is unreliable and crowded. Our first trip on the bus we waited 1/2hr then I had an unfortunate experience with a local man and was ready to go home without seeing any of Rome. We stayed 3 nights based on these reviews and felt we missed out evenings wandering the beautiful centre of Rome so that we got home early to be safe. In saying all of this, the hotel is one of the best. Breakfast is a must!!! Worth €12 as you won't need to eat til dinner. Room was beautiful, so clean, lovely bathroom and good staff. More info would be great about the reality of location on arrival. Would stay again if I was driving (although road rules seem optional). Hate to put a great hotel down due to the locale. Sorry Aeterna!

Reviews.Title: “very confortable”
Reviews.Author: Gmillard
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good value for money. Free wifi. Great breakfast. Convenient parking (paid with facilities 18euros/day or free on the street if you can find a spot). Large rooms, very good and large bathrooms. Jacuzzi included. Convenient to go to city by bus (number 81 or 810) - check bus routes and times through internet: www.atac.it they give the bus times to a specific bus stop. Day tickets for bus+metro are cheap (4 euros/day). Cons: Irritating sometimes to depend on public transportation (bus may take a while to arrive) as there are no metro nearby. So location is not the strongest point.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not 4 star service.”
Reviews.Author: typ01
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean but there is no spa which characterises 4 star hotels. Hotel doesn't provide iron as they claim is a safety regulation which I think is not true since other hotels do. If you need to iron something you need to pay 6 euro per shirt which is outrages. Wi-fi is free but it doesn't work. Location is the greatest either. There are train rails just next to the hotel and it's quite far away from centre. Staff is semi-polity but it could be Italian way. Aircon doesn't work which makes sleeping very difficult and you can't open window because it's next to busy street and train rails. If you need clean room and don't require wi-fi, spa, ironing and to be close to centre it would be perfect for you. I will book something different next time round.

Reviews.Title: “comfort for low money”
Reviews.Author: MoscowSergey
Reviews.Content: New and modern hotel. Yes, location is not fantastic. But it only takes 20 minutes by bus to central station or Piazza Venezia. We lived in a beautiful room with windows to the courtyard. Room is very modern and comfortable. Breakfast is very good and has a great variety of dishes! Price - 89 euros for DBL! I recommend

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: GS1699
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced for Europe. All aspects are very good. The room was a good size, the lobby was welcoming and the reception staff were excellent. Breakfast had good choice, and the restaurant menu for dinner was also varied. The only slight negative point is that the location is slightly set away from most attractions, one has to get a 10 mins bus ride into Termini station then use the Metro. But overall a very nice hotel for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vilen
Reviews.Content: I would not say this is 4 stars hotel. The breakfast is perfect. The room is spacious, it was cleaned daily. But nobody changes lines within 7 days. I forced to changed room because the first one was so noisy that I cannot sleep because of cars and trains. Too far from city center – you need to use train or metro. As local people explained this is a discounted hotel on the Eurostar chain, I do not object but it does not cost 140 Euros per room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingrk2
Reviews.Content: The Eurostar hotel itself was very nice. The lobby and the rooms were large and the bathroom was great. There was a jetted bathtub which was excellent after a hard day in the city. It was very modern and new. The staff was quite helpful. The location was not ideal. There was a bus across the street that you can catch to the main station, Termini. The main station was a bit of a mess to get to the city centre and we ended up taking a taxi to Vatican City to make our tour. The breakfast was a great deal. It was 12 Euro for each person and it had a nice variety with scrambled eggs, sausage, vegetables, and cereal. A nice coffee/cappacino machine as well. The first night we wanted a drink after we got back from all day in the city. It was fine to sit at the tables in the small restaurant near the lobby. The next night we were told that we could not sit there. This was quite odd. All the 'bar' tables on the side were taken and no one was sitting at the 'restaurant' tables. Our option was to sit in the lobby or in a darkened hall outside the breakfast cafeteria. Overall, a nice hotel for the money. The location was not that great, but it was doable with public transport.

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: lodding
Reviews.Content: so cheap so good. stayed 3 nites. room fantastic. med/large. very clean. bathroom very nice with great spa bath (1 person). breakfast excellent. very close to light rail BUT dont try and find it from roma no 1 could tell us where to get it. its right at hotel front door so catch it into town and then you know how to get home but the other way round OMG we just couldnt find it. its only a couple to stops from roma. grocery store just down road and great pizza shop. a couple of resturants but upon looking at menus a bit pricey for the area. we ate in town or grabed a pizza from down the rd and ate at hotel.....6 euro pizza 10/10....only drama we had was reception staff did not always have good english but were very helpful and when i did struggle i asked for someone and she called another girl down who english was excellent.....anything you want just ask for than accomadating.....just a side note be very wary in rome i have travel a lot and i found it to be 1 of the most unsafe places i visited. girls please be very careful i struggled with the men even with my 6 foot solid husband beside me.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Happy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BeLLeM11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Very modern and new and comfortable. We had a great double bed and a very quiet room which after a long day and night out in Rome all you want is to come to a comfortable bed and no noise. The staff was super nice and assisted us in anything we needed. Especially Valentina, she was great. Very professional very friendly. All in all we were treated so well that we did not feel llike just another customer/guest. We did not eat at the hotel only for breakfast once and it was not something to write home about. For breakfast you are better going across the street to the cafe in the corner and having a delicious pastry and capuccino which was very cheap. It was very convinient having the bus stop right in front of the hotel. We took the bus everywhere and getting to the center of Rome took only approx 20 minutes or less at times. Also the via del pigneto area right behind the hotel was great. Small market vendors outside during the day and at night great local restaurants and bars. The atmosphere was great so was the food and the price. Plus being with the locals and away from all the tourist was a good change at night after being in the center all day. I would def stay here again and recommend this hotel to my friends and family. We are so glad we decided on this location. Was there for two weeks and it really felt like home. I read reveiws before about the noise from the metro but we did not hear anything. Our room faced another direction so I am guessing that is why but even in other areas of the hotel we did not hear much noise from trains and/or traffic. Loved the fact that the hotel is not right out by the street. Having it inside the courtyard it is in makes it very quiet and I felt a bit safer. Very very happy with everything.

Reviews.Title: “impressive Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Hooroo40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just so relaxing and energising to come back to at the end of each day to shower, freshen up, relax and head out into the evening again. It exceeded our expectations and was well worth the wee bit extra we would normally pay. I would recommend this to friends and family - a little bit out of the centre of Rome but cabs in were around 10-15 euro and the bus stop straight outside was really handy. Such spacious rooms for this city.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: brian-o-mac
Reviews.Content: The EuroStars hotel is well worth considering when visiting Rome. The rooms are modern, comfortable and an all round good staff service. While the location is not technically central the Metro is only a short walk away and the area surrounding the hotel is interesting. There are wonderful bars and cafes directly behind the hotel that were surprisingly lively and inexpensive. I would defiantly considering staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “New and Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RitchieKurniawan
Reviews.Content: Initially, i emailed the hotel asking about the location. The staff suggest to take tram to the hotel because the bus is usually full. The hotel is quite far from the tram station. But the bus station is just in front of the hotel. I suggest even though the bus is quite full, better take the bus rather the tram. We are welcome with two ladies staff. One is quite rude to us, the other one is can't speak english. but at least the last one is try to explain. We think she is the newbie at the hotel. The hotel is new and modern. We have our own jaccuzi in the room. Great bed. great pillow. Very clean. We ordered room service and the food is great. Free wifi on the room. warm wooden floor. The concern is the location. We think the location is not really safe. a bit out of city center. Overall is great.

Reviews.Title: “Not exact what i expected”
Reviews.Author: JohnB1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new and modern, staff very friendly and helpfull. I think in my room in 8 days never clean the floor, under the bed after 3 days it was a lot of dust, and in room the same. The number of towles is not the same after every change. It was apoximatly the same breakfast in every morning during the 8 days I staing.

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, Tidy , But a bit far”
Reviews.Author: Saman1980
Reviews.Content: We where there in late June for 3 nights, The hotel is very new and well built in comparison to European standard where hotels are typically old! The rooms are very clean and tidy , the room service is great , the breakfast is what a 4 star hotel should be and quit satisfactory. there is a train line just in front of the hotel , I heard some people complained about the noise that the trains make , our room was right in front of the lines but the noise did not interrupt us. The only downside of the hotel is the distance to the city center. It is about 10 minute to Termini main train station of Roma by regional trains and you should wait for a maximum of 10 minutes for trains to come to station. the train station is just in front of the hotel. The tickets can be used for the buses too. Once we used Taxi from piazza Navona to the Hotel that cost us 13 euro , If you are a group of three or four, Taxi is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Highly Recommended!"”
Reviews.Author: IWantToSeeTheWorld31
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel can't be beat! It is new, very clean, and very nice! From the moment we arrived, we were well taken care of. The hotel staff knew it was our honeymoon and had a bottle of champagne on ice and a fruit platter waiting for us in our room. The room itself, was a decent size, very comfortable and very clean. The bathroom was an excellent size and about the only (very minor) problem we had with it was that the shower leaked a little onto the floor since the shower doors didn't seal properly. In terms of location, you need to be prepared to use the public buses or take taxis to the city centre. We almost always used the bus and were in the city centre in less than half an hour. Similarily, the Coliseum was about a 20 minute bus ride away. If you don't want to use public buses, a taxi ride each way would be in the neighbourhood of about 10 Euros, so the money you'd save on the hotel would be spent on taxis (in which case it would make more sense to stay in a hotel in the city centre). We found the bus and subway system fairly easy to use (just buy a day pass from any tabbaco store) and hop on and hop off as often as you want. The hotel staff provided us with a map of the area and labled it with the bus routes for us. We were also able to book several excursions through the hotel (i.e., the Vatican, Naples & Pompeii). The breakfast at the hotel was was awesome - cereals, toast, bacon, eggs, cold cuts, coffee, tea, juice, etc. It was more than enough to keep us going until dinner time. We didn't care for the food at the hotel restaurant at dinner very much, but right around the corner from the hotel, there is an alley that, at night time, comes alive with restaurants and bars. The food is excellent and very reasonably priced. We ended up going there at least three time during our stay. Overall, if you're looking to save some money (and don't mind not being near the city centre) while visiting this very expensive city, this hotel is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice newer hotel, large breakfast spread.”
Reviews.Author: Syd169
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, clean newer, bathrooms great for Italy. 110 Euro per night including breakfast. We took the bus from the train station and that dropped us just a few blocks away. This was the most we paid for the 2 weeks we were in Italy, but Roma is more expensive, and this was a good value for the money. It is east of the train station, but we took the bus into the city each day and it was not hard to get to where you wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, bit far from city center though”
Reviews.Author: nathalie_061
Reviews.Content: Great hotel: friendly welcome, nice and clean rooms, good breakfast buffet. However the hotel is located a bit far from the city center. Bus stops right in front of the hotel and takes you to the city center in about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not so”
Reviews.Author: LGjep
Reviews.Content: We really loved the room, it was beautiful and comfortable. We wish though that the lady at the counter was more friendly. Yes, she was mean and very unfriendly, not fit for what we call "customer service".

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Korey79
Reviews.Content: The customer service of the hotel staff was impeccable! I was greeted with a warm smile from the front desk receptionist, Valentina. Fran was extremely helping in assisting my mother and I with the tours of Rome, which also turned out to be a great choice. Alessandro and Daniele from the hotel´s restaurant staff were enthusiastic and expedient while attending to our dining needs. This hotel truly displays the hospitality of both Rome and all of Italy, and I would highly recommend it to any tourist coming here to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, not-so-beautiful area, s...l...o...w restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ShiftyNJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful inside, very restful and graciously appointed. Hotel staff were generally helpful. Breakfast buffet was more than adequate. Our only complaint was extremely slow service at dinner, when they were not even that busy. We had to keep asking for an update on when our food might arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMorris2010
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was brilliant. The rooms were clean, spacious, with all facilities you need including a jacuzzi bath and very quiet. The breakfast was lovely. However most of all the staff were fantastic, they were so so helpful to everyone who spoke to them, in any language, totally amazing. The hotel is 4 tram stops from the train station and a 105 bus gets you to the train station no problem with the 810 or 810 bus getting you to many sites really quickly and only costing 1 euro. There is a pedestrian area behind the hotel called 'Pigneto' we nicknamed it electric avenue. Serves great food at the many restuarants (my fav was Fontella (I think that was the name but it had homemade beer called theresianer)). such a random mix of people old, young, dog walkers, grandparents taking grandchildren out...dancers...just really funky.....colourful place with a city feel. All in all this is a FAB hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - little bit far from the centre is all...”
Reviews.Author: paul_robinson_85
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights in June 2011. Rooms were great, very modern and clean (and although our rooms were facing the train tracks we didn't hear anything??). The staff were very friendly and helpful - we asked for a couple of restaurant recommendations - one of which (a restaurant called Mr Manzo's, a 5 minute walk from the hotel) was excellent. Couldn't comment on the hotel restaurant as we didn't use it. The one downside was that it is a little far from the centre of Rome - although there is a bus that takes you directly to the Colosseum, to access the other parts of the city you need to take a bus to Termini, and then take another bus or metro to your intended destination. Travelling back from Trastavere, the main eating/drinking district, after a meal proved very tricky - and we eventually succumbed and spent 20 Euros on a taxi to get us back to the hotel. A welcome surprise was the road behind the hotel - a road called Via del Pigneto. This road is full of little bars and a couple of restaurants - they are full of locals (we barely saw any tourists) and the area felt a lot more authentic than a lot of the tourist traps that we found in the centre - additionally everything was more reasonably priced. I'd certainly recommend this road to young couples/travellers as it was great fun spending some time down there. It felt safe too, to us anyway. Would I recommend the hotel to friends? Yes - OK travelling into town each day is a little onerous, but Via del Pigneto really was an unexpected bonus. Would I recommend it to my parents? No - they're probably best off staying somewhere a little more central.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, restaurant adequate”
Reviews.Author: Geocamper
Reviews.Content: Had a great stat at this hotel. The rooms are great, the location ok once you work out transport (safe on buses). Service from all staff we had was excellent. We drank plenty of wine at their wine bar/restaurant. Our tip is to stick to the bar menu and skip the expensive restaurant food. It doesn't stack up and we found the bar food to be better all round. Breakfast ok in a European cake and dessert kinda way...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, though the location's not good and it's noisy (in front of the railways)”
Reviews.Author: nikosgeo
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, free wi fi in the rooms, well furnished, spacy, nice TV set with all the major international chanels, bath tub witrh massage function. Not bouble bed as requested but only two single mattresses together. Parking (free for the motorbikes/scooters). VERY rich and tasty breakfast in a very nice and spacy breakfast salon with tables inside or outside on a beautiful terrace. Safe lock and a very nice hairdryer (professional type). The only disadvantages are the location (35-40 minutes on foot, or 20 minutes by bus because it goes around - plus the waiting) from the Termini station. The noise since it is in front of the railways and in front of a big crossroad. And most of the staff which were more or less not interested about the customers - we didn't feel welcome for sure... If you have a car or a bike it's OK, if not try something more central.

Reviews.Title: “Eccellente !! Tutto ok !! Bellissimo !!”
Reviews.Author: OmarAguirre
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel to stay !! Awesome, modern, new , clean rooms !! A great choice for your money !! Its near the train station , and you can get there easily by bus !! The location its a little bit ugly by night, but the service, the rooms, the staff , everything is great !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but bad location”
Reviews.Author: FilipaMoreira
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 nights with my boyfriend to celebrate my birthday. We choose this hotel due to the quality/price (110 euros per night with breakfast included) and because I loved the rooms decoration. Getting to the hotel is easy, you catch bus 105 from termini and you'll be there in 20 minutes. The hotel is great, very modern, the staff were very nice (they offered a bottle of sparkling wine in my birthday), the room was fantastic, big bed, amazing jacuzzi in the bathroom, all very clean and very nice. Breakfast is also amazing! The ONLY thing we didn't like was the location. In a very poor area, all very dirty. When we left the hotel, there's a near bus stop, just across the street, where you catch the buses to the city centre, and there we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus. The main problem was getting from the centre to the hotel again, especially at night, one time we waited more than 1 hour for one bus, bus 81, at 10 p.m. Also the buses are always very crowded and they smell really bad. We got really tired to wait for buses to get to the hotel, every day it happened, and that kind a ruins the experience in Rome. Despite the hotel being fantastic, you will enjoy much more Rome, if you stay near Piaza Veneza, Piaza Navona, the historic city centre. Termini is also a very bad place to be in a hotel. Loved the hotel, but won't repeat the experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, too many little things lets it down, location not great.”
Reviews.Author: Lola444017
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as it seemed a cheaper alternative to the city, had to get taxi as it was too confusing to get to, once we asked hotel staff it was quite straight forward getting a bus accross the road but area didnt feel safe at night and we tried the tram one night and got lost in the area which was not nice! hotel very clean and modern bit too clinical lacking warmth. staff were very nice and helpful. little things let the hotel down... no shower gel had to ask for it, only 1 english channel only a problem when its raining and nothing else to do in the hotel. no tea/coffee facilities, no water unless you buy from the mini bar, no iron have to get housekeeping to do it and theres a charge and arent available at weekends, no doulble beds only twin, couldnt get an adaptor. breakfast very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah189894
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just off the map of central Rome. It is still a fair location, there are buses right outside the hotel taking you to Termini Station, The Vatikan, Colloseum, and most other places of interest in Rome. Walking distance to San Giovanni in Laterano is approx. 10 minutes, and as far as I am aware that would be the closest Metro stop as well. Of course there are also buses to San Giovanni in Laterano. Cash mashine just outside hotel as well as news agent where you buy bus tickets. Hotel staff where very professional and friendly. Very helpful with city information and so on. Nice enough breakfast. Rooms very clean and comfortable. The area where the hotel is situated is not very pretty and right next to the train line, but with the windows closed you dont hear much noice. I recommend this hotel to anyone not too worried about having to catch the bus to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad directions, Take Taxi”
Reviews.Author: RockToronto
Reviews.Content: Been at the Aeterna Eurostars April 29 to May 2. Booked through the hotel website with a 10% coupon - turned out to be the cheapest I could find for a 4 stars around the center. problem is the word "around". hotel site made you think it is directly at the central station (termini) or very very close. To save time and money we took the express train from the airport - a big mistake. It is not nanywhere near the central station. true - there is about 2-3km only between them, but you have to take a bus or a street car to get there and buses are always always packed in Rome. When you already made it to the hotel it is great. rooms are small but very nicely designed to have everything you need. equipped with all amenities - Small flat TV, Mini bar, jacuzzi, hardwood floors, all perfectly cleaned and brand new. free wi-fi, and phone calls are charged the exact cost. staff had been very helpful, with lots of information about the city and the neighbourhood. My advice - take a taxi from the airport (40-45EU) - it costs the same like the train (the express is 14EU each,& children 50%) and you will get where you want same on the way back. When already there and no luggage - you can take bus, street car or taxi, all are very easy to get to. Walking to the main atttraction or the central bus station is not an option. So - hotel is great, location is pretty close to the center but problematic and definitely not on the center. BTW On the way back We used Rome shuttle Limousine, they were very nice and decently priced at 40Euros. (Phone. +39 0661969084 Mobile. +39 3485141804 Carlotta.+39 3207410072)

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Girlwithlonghair
Reviews.Content: I visited with a friend for 5 days during the beatification ofJohn Paul II. We're two girls in our late 20's and really just went for a short sight seeing trip to Rome. Pros: The hotel looks clean and modern with lots of clean smooth surfaces. There was one computer with free internet access and wifi access was also free. Cons: 1) Very poor service by numerous various reception staff. Asking for hot water we received a response akin to as if we had asked for their firstborn child. Depending on who we spoke to, we were sometimes asked to go and speak to the kitchen ourselves. It seemed like there was no communication between reception and room service. 2) Rooms were lacking in iron facilities and kettle/ cups/ facilities to make tea. Given that the hotel were charging 6 euros (the exchange rate when we went was roughly £1= 1 euro) it would have been nice to have a tea and coffee making set in our rooms rather than spend £6 for a cup of tea! (although this seemed to be the norm for many places in Rome. Coffee on the other hand was a lot cheaper). Likewise we were charged to use their laundry service and reception claimed they did not loan out irons to customers. 3) Location was in a very dodgy area of town far from the main train station Termini and all the major sights. To get to the hotel from the main train station requires a bus journey of around 30 mins. When we returned late one night to the main station we were advised by station staff not to take a bus into the area at that time due to it's poor reputation for crime.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent choice for a weekend visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mikeboy1
Reviews.Content: An excellent welcome awaits you as you arrive at reception. Don't be put off by location this hotel really is easily connected via the two buses that take you right into the station centre of town or to the heart of the tourists sites of the collesseum and up as far as the vatican. Rooms are comfortable and service is very attentive. It is fair to say that the area around the hotel is not particularly attractive but 15 minutes on the bus and you are in the thick of things. A special mention for the restruant, if you are lucky to have Simone as head chef you are in for a real treat. He really is an excellent Chef. The breakfast is a serve yourself but there is everything you could wish for. Finally must mention the excellent manager and staff team, they really do put you at ease and can't do enough for you. Come to Rome, it is the most beautiful city, stay at the aeterna, and you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great quality, for romantic retreat”
Reviews.Author: ReadWalk
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend with my boyfriend there: 1. the service really added value to my stay--very pleasant and attentive receptionists, one of them sent me a lovely morning cake bc he noticed it's my birthday:) 2. Room is high standard--spacious room, modern and elegant design, high quality furnitures, tv with a good selection of channels, and a great bathtub! I think 1+2 made the place perfect for relaxed tourists like us- some sightseeing but also just chilling at hotel. So why it's relatively cheap (apx 100euro/night Sat-Mon): it's far out(although bus is convenient), neighborhood is a little rough comparing to the hotel itself, no good/fancy resturants around (the hotel resturant has very nice service, ok food) .

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, good breakfast, reception staff with attitude.......”
Reviews.Author: Stevelino
Reviews.Content: Great for the value, with the reception staff attitude included, they need to learn that arrogance is not necesarily an asset, room allocation is a lottery, pay serious attention where you get put. One side busy traffic, trains etc, other side, rowdy street cafes all night. Moved room only after serious complaints, still staff reluctant, do not seem to understand the concept that when you take a hotel room you should expect to have the peace to sleep the whole night. Be prepared that when you are there, you are there for the benefit of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, shame about the "little things"”
Reviews.Author: kiwi121
Reviews.Content: The good bits: the hotel itself is modern and the room was really nice, clean, modern and comfy. The location is not very central but is accessible by public transport. We came across a lovely restaurant by accident and it’s just around the corner from the hotel. We had a nice quiet room with a spa bath, really nice at the end of a long day traipsing around the sites! Things that a 4 star hotel should have but this one didn’t: tea & coffee making facility, iron & ironing board, shampoo & conditioner!!, list of contact details including number for reception, information about cafes/ restaurants nearby. The staff members vary, the girl checking us in was a bit patronising and did not tell us that the city tax would be payable in cash only (we were only advised of this on check-out). In the morning, it’s hard to ask staff for anything as they are swamped by people and there’s not enough staff members around. We discovered the lack of iron in the morning and went to see if we could get one, we were told no, for health and safety reasons! Are we 5 years old or what?! Anyway, they can get the item ironed for you for 3 Euros per item I think, which is a bit cheeky but we said okay. We also wanted to get something printed, which they said they could do, just email it to them (great we thought). But a particular staff member seemed not capable of finding an attachment to an email. The shirt and printing drama took over an hour to sort out, which made us late for our booking for the Vatican Museum and caused a lot of stress when we got there. If they fixed the “small stuff”, it would make this a really great 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ludenvagner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, staff were friendly, food was good, absolute bargain for the price we got it for! I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The Hotel; Very modern hotel, it's apparent it's used frequently by people on business due to the high standard and finish of the hotel. The Rooms; The room we had was a double room with a balcony and the balcony was twice the size of our room, huge! If you choose to book this hotel send an e-mail to the reception desk (address can be found on their website) and put in a request for a double with a balcony! It can't be guaranteed but you may as well give it a go as we did and were given a lovely room.) The room itself had a lovely king size comfortable bed with a sofa at the end of it. Lots of space to walk around in, the bathroom was of high quality, although the bath (a jacuzzi bath) was on the small side for a larger guy like me but i usually shower anyway so not a big deal! Location; It's not central Rome however you are literally about 10 mins bus ride away from everything,once you get used to using the public transportation in Rome it really isn't difficult to navigate your way around, the bus top is literally across the road or down the road to your left depending which direction you wish to travel so that made getting the bus really easy. Directly behind the hotel where our balcony is located you look down upon a street where you can find a supermarket, bar, cafe, food etc so if you didn't want to spend your money on the mini bar you could go to the supermarket and get yourself some food and drinks from there at really cheap prices! Staff; The staff were most helpful and friendly, room service cleaned our rooms ever when we were late leaving in the day, the receptionist gave us a map upon arrival listed all the bus routes we should take and gave us loads of helpful information. When we used the mini bar they would call up to the room to see if we would like it restocked with anything in particular. There was only one downfall which was when my other half requested to have her top cleaned and ironed and ticked the "Delivered Next Day" option and it was not returned the following day. We spoke to reception who apologised however where this isn't done in the hotel we had to wait to the following day, not a big deal but listening to my partner go on and on for 24 hours about her top is a big deal to me! All in all if you can get this hotel at a good price and it's much cheaper than the ones in central don't worry about the location you will be fine it's not that far out at all and this hotel is worth it's money. If you do find a modern upmarket hotel in central and it is cheaper than this hotel then you may as well go for that because if you can get more central it is handy however a lot of the hotels in central are very outdated and tired so be sure to read your reviews and look at some pictures and keep this hotel in mind because i thought it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: raymondoWales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated a 5-10 Min bus ride out side of Rome and can be easily reached on the 105 bus which takes you to the termini for 1 Euro. The hotel is clean and modern and rooms are a good size. we had 6 double rooms booked with no complaints about service or standard. Staff are friendly and most speak some sort of English to help the cause.Rooms were cleaned daily and fresh towels etc. were all changed on a daily basis also hotel breakfasts can be purchased there if you don't want to book them on-line, as we found it was cheaper to buy breakfast at 12 Euro per day rather than pay 25 Euro cost if booked as part of your holiday Now the not so negative but points: Could have done with a tea or coffee making facility in the room. Nothing beats a brew when you get up and your head feels if it has had 10 gallons of beer (which i think some of us had) Some of the rooms mine was A108, face the corner junction of the road and my room overlooked the main road. This is why my review is called Grand Prix.....because at 6am the cars and lorries start and the chance of a lie in are minimal horns blaring, sirens ambulances police, it does nt stop..........so be wary of room view try and get an internal room that just looks out into their own courtyard. other points to watch the taxi drivers will rip you off...........a journey in a taxi from the Termini was 12 Euro which we paid and were happy with however on match-day and us in our welsh jerseys this amazing journey went to 50 euros then after swift JOG ON Matey Boy, miraculously came down to 40, 30 25 and they still tried to rip us off, so buyer beware and get used to the bus and tram system...........Metro system full of pickpockets so again watch your wallets and watches........and so thats about it really...................cheers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent (value for money)”
Reviews.Author: KStef
Reviews.Content: Quite outside the city center, but : - very comfortable ( newly opened) - spacy rooms - like 20m from bus ( directly to Termini - from this you can get everywhere) - kind & helpfull & lovely staff - delicious breakfast. I can't imagine greater choice for few day stay in Rome. Great value for money and very easy way to get to the city center. Moreover, due to the fact it was our 5th anniversary we were given champagne to our room as a nice surprice :) One advice: book room oposite side that the street as might be loud.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: johnnee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, very clean, with comfortable and spacious rooms and nice interior design. The hot tub with Jacuzzi was a bless at the end of the day. The stuff is friendly and polite and willing to help and assist you during your stay. It is located near the border of so called historical center of Rome in a quiet and decent area. Easy accessible from Termini, main train station, bus line 105 (get down at bus station “Ponte Casilino”) or from Saint Giovanni metro station, bus line 81 or 810 (get down at bus station “Ponte Casilino”). It’s a 7-10 min walk to metro station Saint Giovanni. The bus lines 810 and 81 connects the hotel to the main sights to visit in Rome: Vatican Museum and St. Peter Square and Basilica, Coloseum, Piazza Venezia – Monument of Victor Emanuel II and Traian Column and Museum, Piazza Navona. For more details look on the Atac Rome transportation website. You’ll find near the hotel a pedestrian open market street with different kinds of stuff during the week. On Sunday afternoon we found the street became a handmade market / exhibition. We definitely recommend this hotel for both business and tourism trips in Rome. Thank you, Eurostars. We’re looking forward to seeing you again.

Reviews.Title: “zero atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: 11elevenexperience
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new clean, with comfortable beds and great bathrooms- but there is absolutely NO character, atmosphere or personality (from staff included). The reception is like entering the foyer of a business centre, very odd for a hotel and the decor although modern felt more like a 21st century prison to me. Location- terrible..rough area and no good eating near by. I had stayed previously at 2 star Hotel Prati near the vatican and preferred that far more than this 4 star concrete jungle. Even though , the beds are good, along with the jet spa baths..in my opinion when in Rome location should be priority! Staff (although professional as far as dealing with you) need to get some personality- obviously management want them to be stiff and reserved, but this along with the stiff atmosphere of the building makes it all quite unwelcoming. Also had a maid walk in to my room while i was sleeping and had the "do not disturb" sign on the door. why even have the signs if they aren't willing to respect them? I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you particularly wanted to be in this area.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A (GOOD) SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: marco_and_nadine
Reviews.Content: Needed to find a last minute hotel for business trip in Rome. All traditional places seemed fully booked. Picked up this Eurostars after checking positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Excellent choice! It's a brand new hotel belonging to Spanish chain, by converting an old factory. They were still finishing last details (gym was not ready yet) but all the necessary things were at their place. Excellent room furniture. The bathroom (one of the most important items in my personal judgement for a hotel room) was IMPECCABLE. Immaculate Jacuzzi available. Truly excellent. Breakfast buffet is exceeding any expectation, especially after considering the very limited breakfast choice that you have in so many hotels in Rome. Hotel located a little far from the center, you have to take a bus, taxi or a metropolitam train to reach the traditional touristic areas, but still in a busy neighborod (you have pizzerias and restaurants at walking distance). Only downside, my room was on the street side where the railway is. the train is quite noise from early morning to around midnight. probably the rooms on the other sides do not have this problem. Staff very polite and ready to help you. The manager came out from the hotel to show me personally where to buy train tickets and where to pick up the train. Definitely recommended for business and tourism. Ah, those Spanish!

Reviews.Title: “Newly opened, a little out of centre - worth staying if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: peterperich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here purely because of the 25% off special which we found due to the hotel just opening in September 2010. For the price, it really was a great value hotel. However, once the prices go up, I am not so sure. Given how new it was, it was difficult to find many reviews online, so hopefully this may be of some assistance for those considering whether to stay there. The hotel has been recently renovated and everything inside is modern. The rooms were particularly nice and it was certainly very clean. When we arrived, it was clear that the hotel was adding the finishing touches and had just been opened as there were a few minor teething problems, such as the computer system crashing on check-in, however, this was resolved with a few glasses of nice prosecco while we waited! Our room also had no blanket but they were quick to bring us a brand new one when we asked. The hotel felt like it was more aimed at business clientele rather than tourists. The location was ok, a little out of the centre, but there was a bus stop and a yellow tram line (to Termini) out front. Both came regularly so transport towards the sights of old Rome was not really very difficult (although a lot slower than if you stayed more centrally). Overall, the hotel was pretty much what you’d expect from a new 4 star hotel without having any stand-out features. Stay here if you get a cheap deal, or if you like very new, modern and clean accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “warning booking this hotel may not actually mean staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeboy1
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here as we had tickets to see U2 in Rome. Upon check in, in plenty of time for the concert, the Hotel told us there was a "problem". It appears they had overbooked and insisted they move us to another one of their city hotels. They didn't tell us it was 20km away! Not only did we lose the city centre location but the hotel they moved us to was a dump, miles from anywhere and away from the metro and sites. The move meant we were late for the concert, we negotiated they paid for a taxi to at least get us there. To add insult to injury the Hotel then refused to pay the full taxi amount and offered us only half. We had to pay an extra 50 euros ourselves! The move and being based out of the City added seriously to the journey time for our all too brief weekend. Complaints were futile, the manager refused to meet or speak with us and the Receptionist staff conveyed messages back and forth. We didn't let this bunch of amateurs ruin our weekend but be warned if you book this City Hotel be aware what you see on line might not be what you get and learn some Italian as complaining in English was useless.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Roma Aeterna
HotelInfo.Address: Via Casilina 125, 00176 Rome, Italy
